thread.title: Dog in sweltering car leads to arrest
thread.title_full: Dog in sweltering car leads to arrest

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Dog in sweltering car leads to arrest
text:
Monday's unseasonably warm weather nearly proved tragic when an Ontario County man left a beagle puppy alone in a car for 45 minutes as the temperature inside soared over 100 degrees. The incident happened outside Wal-mart in Canandaigua at about 3 p.m. Monday, according to the Ontario County Sheriff's Office. Marc Cooper, 47, of Shortsville, left the dog in his car for at least 45 minutes with no water and little ventilation.
Two people called police to report it. When officers arrived, the dog was panting and the temperature inside the car registered between 114 and 118 degrees.
Cooper was charged with a violation under Agriculture and Markets law and will return to Hopewell Town Court. The dog was given water and released to a third party, according to the sheriff's office.
